overview: Copilot code review (CCR) now blends LLM detections and tool calling with deterministic tools like ESLint and CodeQL, delivering smarter reviews and a seamless handoff to the Copilot coding agent for fixes.

bullets: You can now hand off suggested changes directly to the Copilot coding agent . Mention @copilot in your pull request, and CCR will automatically apply the suggested fixes in a stacked pull request, ready for you to review and merge.

bullets: With customizable workflows and multi-editor support already generally available, CCR now fits seamlessly into every step of your development process, from writing code to reviewing and merging.

Teams can define their own review standards and tone through instructions.md or copilot-instructions.md files, shaping what CCR prioritizes (e.g., test coverage, performance, or readability). CCR is available in VS Code, Visual Studio, JetBrains, Xcode, and on github.com, ensuring consistent feedback wherever you work.
